remarks: A Sylow subgroup that is contained in a larger subgroup is also Sylow with respect to the subgroup.  (The converse need not be true.) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Jan-2015.)
statement:
subgslw.1 $e |- H = ( G |`s S ) $.
subgslw $p |- ( ( S e. ( SubGrp ` G ) /\ K e. ( P pSyl G ) /\ K C_ S ) -> K e. ( P pSyl H ) ) $.
